Intervention: The adjuvant radiation started within 12 weeks of local excision or reexcision of the breast.
Eligibility: The histologically proven phyllode tumours of the breast with borderline or malignant grade, defined as 1 of the following:
- Borderline, defined as 5-9 mitoses/10 high-power fields (HPF), pushing or infiltrating margins, 2+ atypy
- Magnon, defined as 10 mitoses or more/10 HPF, mainly infiltrating margins, usually 3+ atypies with 2+ occasional atypies
• Must have been excised with breast conservation resection and no positive margin
Local recurrence of previously excised phyllode tumour if recurrence is within the area of anterior excision
No anterior breast carcinoma or in situ ductal carcinoma in the ipsilateral breast
Fertile patients should use effective contraception
Radiotherapy: No prior radiation therapy in the ipsilateral breast
Results: Local recurrence rate of phyllode tumours
Time limit: 36 months after initial excision
Title of the arm/group: Adjuvant Radiotherapy
Description of the arm/group: Adjuvant radiation began within 12 weeks of local excision or breast reexcision.
Type of measure: Number of participants
